The success of an intelligent behavior of a system can be measured with Turing Test.
Two persons and a machine to be evaluated participate in the test. Out of the two persons, one plays the role of the tester. Each of them sits in different rooms. The tester is unaware of who is machine and who is a human. He interrogates the questions by typing and sending them to both intelligences, to which he receives typed responses.
This test aims at fooling the tester. If the tester fails to determine machineï¿½s response from the human response, then the machine is said to be intelligent.
The Turing Test proposed by Alan Turig (1950) was designed to provide a satisfactory operational defination of Intelligence.The Computer would need to posses the following capabilities-
>>Natural language processing to enable it to communicate successfully in English
>>Knowledge representation to store what it knows or hears
>>Automated reasoning to use the stored information to answer questions and new conclusions
>>Machine learning to adapt new circumstance and to detect and extrapolate patterns
To pass the turing test,the computer will also need-
>>Robotics-- to manipulate objects and move about
